intro: Colletia exserta, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system.
